member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableSsl.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.App.Environment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Environment.
An array of EnvironmentVariable objects that specify environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server instances. For more information, see Environment Variables.
There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables. However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes the variables' names, values, and protected flag values - cannot exceed 10 KB (10240 Bytes). This limit should accommodate most if not all use cases, but if you do exceed it, you will cause an exception (API) with an "Environment: is too large (maximum is 10KB)" message.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssignInstanceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssignInstance operation. Assign a registered instance to a layer.
You can assign registered on-premises instances to any layer type.
You can assign registered Amazon EC2 instances only to custom layers.
You cannot use this action with instances that were created with AWS OpsWorks.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssignInstanceRequest.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The instance ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssignInstanceRequest.LayerIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LayerIds.
The layer ID, which must correspond to a custom layer. You cannot assign a registered instance to a built-in layer.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssignInstanceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the AssignInstance operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssignVolumeRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssignVolume operation. Assigns one of the stack's registered Amazon EBS volumes to a specified instance. The volume must first be registered with the stack by calling RegisterVolume. After you register the volume, you must call UpdateVolume to specify a mount point before calling AssignVolume. For more information, see Resource Management.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssignVolumeRequest.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The instance ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssignVolumeRequest.VolumeId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeId.
The volume ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssignVolumeResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the AssignVolume operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssociateElasticIpRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssociateElasticIp operation. Associates one of the stack's registered Elastic IP addresses with a specified instance. The address must first be registered with the stack by calling RegisterElasticIp. For more information, see Resource Management.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssociateElasticIpRequest.ElasticIp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ElasticIp.
The Elastic IP address.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssociateElasticIpRequest.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The instance ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AssociateElasticIpResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the AssociateElasticIp operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AttachElasticLoadBalancerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AttachElasticLoadBalancer operation. Attaches an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer to a specified layer. For more information, see Elastic Load Balancing.
You must create the Elastic Load Balancing instance separately, by using the Elastic Load Balancing console, API, or CLI. For more information, see Elastic Load Balancing Developer Guide.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AttachElasticLoadBalancerRequest.ElasticLoadBalancerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ElasticLoadBalancerName.
The Elastic Load Balancing instance's name.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AttachElasticLoadBalancerRequest.LayerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LayerId.
The ID of the layer that the Elastic Load Balancing instance is to be attached to.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AttachElasticLoadBalancerResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the AttachElasticLoadBalancer operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AutoScalingThresholds
member.summary: Describes a load-based auto scaling upscaling or downscaling threshold configuration, which specifies when AWS OpsWorks starts or stops load-based instances.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AutoScalingThresholds.Alarms
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Alarms.
Custom Cloudwatch auto scaling alarms, to be used as thresholds. This parameter takes a list of up to five alarm names, which are case sensitive and must be in the same region as the stack.
To use custom alarms, you must update your service role to allow cloudwatch:DescribeAlarms. You can either have AWS OpsWorks update the role for you when you first use this feature or you can edit the role manually. For more information, see Allowing AWS OpsWorks to Act on Your Behalf.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AutoScalingThresholds.CpuThreshold
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CpuThreshold.
The CPU utilization threshold, as a percent of the available CPU. A value of -1 disables the threshold.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AutoScalingThresholds.IgnoreMetricsTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IgnoreMetricsTime.
The amount of time (in minutes) after a scaling event occurs that AWS OpsWorks should ignore metrics and suppress additional scaling events. For example, AWS OpsWorks adds new instances following an upscaling event but the instances won't start reducing the load until they have been booted and configured. There is no point in raising additional scaling events during that operation, which typically takes several minutes. IgnoreMetricsTime allows you to direct AWS OpsWorks to suppress scaling events long enough to get the new instances online.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AutoScalingThresholds.InstanceCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceCount.
The number of instances to add or remove when the load exceeds a threshold.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AutoScalingThresholds.LoadThreshold
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LoadThreshold.
The load threshold. A value of -1 disables the threshold. For more information about how load is computed, see Load (computing).

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AutoScalingThresholds.MemoryThreshold
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MemoryThreshold.
The memory utilization threshold, as a percent of the available memory. A value of -1 disables the threshold.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.AutoScalingThresholds.ThresholdsWaitTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThresholdsWaitTime.
The amount of time, in minutes, that the load must exceed a threshold before more instances are added or removed.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.BlockDeviceMapping
member.summary: Describes a block device mapping. This data type maps directly to the Amazon EC2 BlockDeviceMapping data type.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.BlockDeviceMapping.DeviceName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeviceName.
The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh. For the root device, you can use the explicit device name or you can set this parameter to ROOT_DEVICE and AWS OpsWorks will provide the correct device name.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.BlockDeviceMapping.Ebs
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Ebs.
An EBSBlockDevice that defines how to configure an Amazon EBS volume when the instance is launched.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.BlockDeviceMapping.NoDevice
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NoDevice.
Suppresses the specified device included in the AMI's block device mapping.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.BlockDeviceMapping.VirtualName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualName.
The virtual device name. For more information, see BlockDeviceMapping.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.ChefConfiguration
member.summary: Describes the Chef configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.ChefConfiguration.BerkshelfVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BerkshelfVersion.
The Berkshelf version.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.ChefConfiguration.ManageBerkshelf
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManageBerkshelf.
Whether to enable Berkshelf.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CloneStack operation. Creates a clone of a specified stack. For more information, see Clone a Stack. By default, all parameters are set to the values used by the parent stack.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.AgentVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentVersion.
The default AWS OpsWorks agent version. You have the following options:
Auto-update - Set this parameter to LATEST. AWS OpsWorks automatically installs new agent versions on the stack's instances as soon as they are available.
Fixed version - Set this parameter to your preferred agent version. To update the agent version, you must edit the stack configuration and specify a new version. AWS OpsWorks then automatically installs that version on the stack's instances.
The default setting is LATEST. To specify an agent version, you must use the complete version number, not the abbreviated number shown on the console. For a list of available agent version numbers, call DescribeAgentVersions.
You can also specify an agent version when you create or update an instance, which overrides the stack's default setting.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
A list of stack attributes and values as key/value pairs to be added to the cloned stack.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.ChefConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChefConfiguration.
A ChefConfiguration object that specifies whether to enable Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version on Chef 11.10 stacks. For more information, see Create a New Stack.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.CloneAppIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CloneAppIds.
A list of source stack app IDs to be included in the cloned stack.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.ClonePermissions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClonePermissions.
Whether to clone the source stack's permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.ConfigurationManager
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationManager.
The configuration manager. When you clone a stack we recommend that you use the configuration manager to specify the Chef version: 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for Linux stacks, or 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for Linux stacks is currently 11.4.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.CustomCookbooksSource
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CustomCookbooksSource.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.CustomJson
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomJson.
A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It is used to override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values. The string should be in the following format and must escape characters such as '"':
"{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
For more information on custom JSON, see Use Custom JSON to Modify the Stack Configuration Attributes

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.DefaultAvailabilityZone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultAvailabilityZone.
The cloned stack's default Availability Zone, which must be in the specified region. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints. If you also specify a value for DefaultSubnetId, the subnet must be in the same zone. For more information, see the VpcId parameter description.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.DefaultInstanceProfileArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultInstanceProfileArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.DefaultOs
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultOs.
The stack's operating system, which must be set to one of the following.
A supported Linux operating system: An Amazon Linux version, such as Amazon Linux 2015.03, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, or Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.
Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2 Base.
A custom AMI: Custom. You specify the custom AMI you want to use when you create instances. For more information on how to use custom AMIs with OpsWorks, see Using Custom AMIs.
The default option is the parent stack's operating system. For more information on the supported operating systems, see AWS OpsWorks Operating Systems.
You can specify a different Linux operating system for the cloned stack, but you cannot change from Linux to Windows or Windows to Linux.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.DefaultRootDeviceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultRootDeviceType.
The default root device type. This value is used by default for all instances in the cloned stack, but you can override it when you create an instance. For more information, see Storage for the Root Device.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.DefaultSshKeyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultSshKeyName.
A default Amazon EC2 key pair name. The default value is none. If you specify a key pair name, AWS OpsWorks installs the public key on the instance and you can use the private key with an SSH client to log in to the instance. For more information, see
Using SSH to Communicate with an Instance and Managing SSH Access. You can override this setting by specifying a different key pair, or no key pair, when you create an instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.DefaultSubnetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultSubnetId.
The stack's default VPC subnet ID. This parameter is required if you specify a value for the VpcId parameter. All instances are launched into this subnet unless you specify otherwise when you create the instance. If you also specify a value for DefaultAvailabilityZone, the subnet must be in that zone. For information on default values and when this parameter is required, see the VpcId parameter description.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.HostnameTheme
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostnameTheme.
The stack's host name theme, with spaces are replaced by underscores. The theme is used to generate host names for the stack's instances. By default, HostnameTheme is set to Layer_Dependent, which creates host names by appending integers to the layer's short name. The other themes are:
Baked_Goods
Clouds
Europe_Cities
Fruits
Greek_Deities
Legendary_creatures_from_Japan
Planets_and_Moons
Roman_Deities
Scottish_Islands
US_Cities
Wild_Cats
To obtain a generated host name, call GetHostNameSuggestion, which returns a host name based on the current theme.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The cloned stack name.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.Region
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Region.
The cloned stack AWS region, such as "us-east-1". For more information about AWS regions, see Regions and Endpoints.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.ServiceRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRoleArn.
The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role, which allows AWS OpsWorks to work with AWS resources on your behalf. You must set this parameter to the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an existing IAM role. If you create a stack by using the AWS OpsWorks console, it creates the role for you. You can obtain an existing stack's IAM ARN programmatically by calling DescribePermissions. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers.
You must set this parameter to a valid service role ARN or the action will fail; there is no default value. You can specify the source stack's service role ARN, if you prefer, but you must do so explicitly.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.SourceStackId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceStackId.
The source stack ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.UseCustomCookbooks
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseCustomCookbooks.
Whether to use custom cookbooks.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.UseOpsworksSecurityGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseOpsworksSecurityGroups.
Whether to associate the AWS OpsWorks built-in security groups with the stack's layers.
AWS OpsWorks provides a standard set of built-in security groups, one for each layer, which are associated with layers by default. With UseOpsworksSecurityGroups you can instead provide your own custom security groups. UseOpsworksSecurityGroups has the following settings:
True - AWS OpsWorks automatically associates the appropriate built-in security group with each layer (default setting). You can associate additional security groups with a layer after you create it but you cannot delete the built-in security group.
False - AWS OpsWorks does not associate built-in security groups with layers. You must create appropriate Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) security groups and associate a security group with each layer that you create. However, you can still manually associate a built-in security group with a layer on creation; custom security groups are required only for those layers that need custom settings.
For more information, see Create a New Stack.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackRequest.VpcId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcId.
The ID of the VPC that the cloned stack is to be launched into. It must be in the specified region. All instances are launched into this VPC, and you cannot change the ID later.
If your account supports EC2 Classic, the default value is no VPC.
If your account does not support EC2 Classic, the default value is the default VPC for the specified region.
If the VPC ID corresponds to a default VPC and you have specified either the DefaultAvailabilityZone or the DefaultSubnetId parameter only, AWS OpsWorks infers the value of the other parameter. If you specify neither parameter, AWS OpsWorks sets these parameters to the first valid Availability Zone for the specified region and the corresponding default VPC subnet ID, respectively.
If you specify a nondefault VPC ID, note the following:
It must belong to a VPC in your account that is in the specified region.
You must specify a value for DefaultSubnetId.
For more information on how to use AWS OpsWorks with a VPC, see Running a Stack in a VPC. For more information on default VPC and EC2 Classic, see Supported Platforms.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackResponse
member.summary: Contains the response to a CloneStack request.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CloneStackResponse.StackId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StackId.
The cloned stack ID.

Date and time when the command was acknowledged.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Command.CommandId

The command ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Command.CompletedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletedAt.
Date when the command completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Command.CreatedAt

Date and time when the command was run.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Command.DeploymentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeploymentId.
The command deployment ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Command.ExitCode

Gets and sets the property ExitCode.
The command exit code.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Command.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The ID of the instance where the command was executed.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Command.LogUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LogUrl.
The URL of the command log.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Command.Status

The command status:
failed
successful

deploy

install_dependencies

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateApp operation. Creates an app for a specified stack. For more information, see Creating Apps.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.AppSource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AppSource.
A Source object that specifies the app repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.DataSources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSources.
The app's data source.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the app.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.Domains
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Domains.
The app virtual host settings, with multiple domains separated by commas. For example: 'www.example.com, example.com'

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.EnableSsl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableSsl.
Whether to enable SSL for the app.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.Environment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Environment.
An array of EnvironmentVariable objects that specify environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server instance. For more information, see Environment Variables.
There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables. However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes the variables' names, values, and protected flag values - cannot exceed 10 KB (10240 Bytes). This limit should accommodate most if not all use cases. Exceeding it will cause an exception with the message, "Environment: is too large (maximum is 10KB)."
This parameter is supported only by Chef 11.10 stacks. If you have specified one or more environment variables, you cannot modify the stack's Chef version.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The app name.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.Shortname
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Shortname.
The app's short name.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.SslConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SslConfiguration.
An SslConfiguration object with the SSL configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.StackId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StackId.
The stack ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppRequest.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The app type. Each supported type is associated with a particular layer. For example, PHP applications are associated with a PHP layer. AWS OpsWorks deploys an application to those instances that are members of the corresponding layer. If your app isn't one of the standard types, or you prefer to implement your own Deploy recipes, specify other.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppResponse
member.summary: Contains the response to a CreateApp request.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateAppResponse.AppId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AppId.
The app ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateDeploymentRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateDeployment operation. Runs deployment or stack commands. For more information, see Deploying Apps and Run Stack Commands.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Deploy or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateDeploymentRequest.AppId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AppId.
The app ID. This parameter is required for app deployments, but not for other deployment commands.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateDeploymentRequest.Command
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Command.
A DeploymentCommand object that specifies the deployment command and any associated arguments.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateDeploymentRequest.Comment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Comment.
A user-defined comment.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateDeploymentRequest.CustomJson
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomJson.
A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It is used to override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values. The string should be in the following format and must escape characters such as '"':
"{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
For more information on custom JSON, see Use Custom JSON to Modify the Stack Configuration Attributes.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateDeploymentRequest.InstanceIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceIds.
The instance IDs for the deployment targets.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateDeploymentRequest.StackId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StackId.
The stack ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateDeploymentResponse
member.summary: Contains the response to a CreateDeployment request.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateDeploymentResponse.DeploymentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeploymentId.
The deployment ID, which can be used with other requests to identify the deployment.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateInstance operation. Creates an instance in a specified stack. For more information, see Adding an Instance to a Layer.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.AgentVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentVersion.
The default AWS OpsWorks agent version. You have the following options:
INHERIT - Use the stack's default agent version setting.
version_number - Use the specified agent version. This value overrides the stack's default setting. To update the agent version, edit the instance configuration and specify a new version. AWS OpsWorks then automatically installs that version on the instance.
The default setting is INHERIT. To specify an agent version, you must use the complete version number, not the abbreviated number shown on the console. For a list of available agent version numbers, call DescribeAgentVersions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.AmiId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AmiId.
A custom AMI ID to be used to create the instance. The AMI should be based on one of the supported operating systems. For more information, see Using Custom AMIs.
If you specify a custom AMI, you must set Os to Custom.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.Architecture
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Architecture.
The instance architecture. The default option is x86_64. Instance types do not necessarily support both architectures. For a list of the architectures that are supported by the different instance types, see Instance Families and Types.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.AutoScalingType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingType.
For load-based or time-based instances, the type. Windows stacks can use only time-based instances.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.AvailabilityZone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZone.
The instance Availability Zone. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.BlockDeviceMappings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockDeviceMappings.
An array of BlockDeviceMapping objects that specify the instance's block devices. For more information, see Block Device Mapping. Note that block device mappings are not supported for custom AMIs.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.EbsOptimized
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EbsOptimized.
Whether to create an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.Hostname
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Hostname.
The instance host name.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.InstallUpdatesOnBoot
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstallUpdatesOnBoot.
Whether to install operating system and package updates when the instance boots. The default value is true. To control when updates are installed, set this value to false. You must then update your instances manually by using CreateDeployment to run the update_dependencies stack command or by manually running yum (Amazon Linux) or apt-get (Ubuntu) on the instances.
We strongly recommend using the default value of true to ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.InstanceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceType.
The instance type, such as t2.micro. For a list of supported instance types, open the stack in the console, choose Instances, and choose + Instance. The Size list contains the currently supported types. For more information, see Instance Families and Types. The parameter values that you use to specify the various types are in the API Name column of the Available Instance Types table.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.LayerIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LayerIds.
An array that contains the instance's layer IDs.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.Os
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Os.
The instance's operating system, which must be set to one of the following.
A supported Linux operating system: An Amazon Linux version, such as Amazon Linux 2015.03, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, or Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.
Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2 Base.
A custom AMI: Custom.
For more information on the supported operating systems, see AWS OpsWorks Operating Systems.
The default option is the current Amazon Linux version. If you set this parameter to Custom, you must use the CreateInstance action's AmiId parameter to specify the custom AMI that you want to use. Block device mappings are not supported if the value is Custom. For more information on the supported operating systems, see Operating SystemsFor more information on how to use custom AMIs with AWS OpsWorks, see Using Custom AMIs.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.RootDeviceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RootDeviceType.
The instance root device type. For more information, see Storage for the Root Device.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.SshKeyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SshKeyName.
The instance's Amazon EC2 key-pair name.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.StackId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StackId.
The stack ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.SubnetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubnetId.
The ID of the instance's subnet. If the stack is running in a VPC, you can use this parameter to override the stack's default subnet ID value and direct AWS OpsWorks to launch the instance in a different subnet.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceRequest.VirtualizationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VirtualizationType.
The instance's virtualization type, paravirtual or hvm.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceResponse
member.summary: Contains the response to a CreateInstance request.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateInstanceResponse.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The instance ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLayer operation. Creates a layer. For more information, see How to Create a Layer.
You should use CreateLayer for noncustom layer types such as PHP App Server only if the stack does not have an existing layer of that type. A stack can have at most one instance of each noncustom layer; if you attempt to create a second instance, CreateLayer fails. A stack can have an arbitrary number of custom layers, so you can call CreateLayer as many times as you like for that layer type.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
One or more user-defined key-value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.
To create a cluster layer, set the EcsClusterArn attribute to the cluster's ARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.AutoAssignElasticIps
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoAssignElasticIps.
Whether to automatically assign an Elastic IP address to the layer's instances. For more information, see How to Edit a Layer.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.AutoAssignPublicIps
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoAssignPublicIps.
For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign a public IP address to the layer's instances. For more information, see How to Edit a Layer.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.CustomInstanceProfileArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomInstanceProfileArn.
The ARN of an IAM profile to be used for the layer's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.CustomJson
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomJson.
A JSON-formatted string containing custom stack configuration and deployment attributes to be installed on the layer's instances. For more information, see Using Custom JSON. This feature is supported as of version 1.7.42 of the AWS CLI.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.CustomRecipes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomRecipes.
A LayerCustomRecipes object that specifies the layer custom recipes.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.CustomSecurityGroupIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomSecurityGroupIds.
An array containing the layer custom security group IDs.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.EnableAutoHealing
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableAutoHealing.
Whether to disable auto healing for the layer.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.InstallUpdatesOnBoot
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstallUpdatesOnBoot.
Whether to install operating system and package updates when the instance boots. The default value is true. To control when updates are installed, set this value to false. You must then update your instances manually by using CreateDeployment to run the update_dependencies stack command or by manually running yum (Amazon Linux) or apt-get (Ubuntu) on the instances.
To ensure that your instances have the latest security updates, we strongly recommend using the default value of true.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.LifecycleEventConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LifecycleEventConfiguration.
A LifeCycleEventConfiguration object that you can use to configure the Shutdown event to specify an execution timeout and enable or disable Elastic Load Balancer connection draining.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The layer name, which is used by the console.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.Packages
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Packages.
An array of Package objects that describes the layer packages.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.Shortname
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Shortname.
For custom layers only, use this parameter to specify the layer's short name, which is used internally by AWS OpsWorks and by Chef recipes. The short name is also used as the name for the directory where your app files are installed. It can have a maximum of 200 characters, which are limited to the alphanumeric characters, '-', '_', and '.'.
The built-in layers' short names are defined by AWS OpsWorks. For more information, see the Layer Reference.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.StackId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StackId.
The layer stack ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The layer type. A stack cannot have more than one built-in layer of the same type. It can have any number of custom layers.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.UseEbsOptimizedInstances
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseEbsOptimizedInstances.
Whether to use Amazon EBS-optimized instances.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateLayerRequest.VolumeConfigurations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeConfigurations.
A VolumeConfigurations object that describes the layer's Amazon EBS volumes.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateStack operation. Creates a new stack. For more information, see Create a New Stack.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.AgentVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentVersion.
The default AWS OpsWorks agent version. You have the following options:
Auto-update - Set this parameter to LATEST. AWS OpsWorks automatically installs new agent versions on the stack's instances as soon as they are available.
Fixed version - Set this parameter to your preferred agent version. To update the agent version, you must edit the stack configuration and specify a new version. AWS OpsWorks then automatically installs that version on the stack's instances.
The default setting is the most recent release of the agent. To specify an agent version, you must use the complete version number, not the abbreviated number shown on the console. For a list of available agent version numbers, call DescribeAgentVersions.
You can also specify an agent version when you create or update an instance, which overrides the stack's default setting.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
One or more user-defined key-value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.ChefConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChefConfiguration.
A ChefConfiguration object that specifies whether to enable Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version on Chef 11.10 stacks. For more information, see Create a New Stack.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.ConfigurationManager
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationManager.
The configuration manager. When you create a stack we recommend that you use the configuration manager to specify the Chef version: 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for Linux stacks, or 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for Linux stacks is currently 11.4.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.CustomCookbooksSource
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CustomCookbooksSource.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.CustomJson
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomJson.
A string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It can be used to override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the following escape characters such as '"':
"{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
For more information on custom JSON, see Use Custom JSON to Modify the Stack Configuration Attributes.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.DefaultAvailabilityZone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultAvailabilityZone.
The stack's default Availability Zone, which must be in the specified region. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints. If you also specify a value for DefaultSubnetId, the subnet must be in the same zone. For more information, see the VpcId parameter description.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.DefaultInstanceProfileArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultInstanceProfileArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.DefaultOs
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultOs.
The stack's default operating system, which is installed on every instance unless you specify a different operating system when you create the instance. You can specify one of the following.
A supported Linux operating system: An Amazon Linux version, such as Amazon Linux 2015.03, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, or Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.
Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2 Base.
A custom AMI: Custom. You specify the custom AMI you want to use when you create instances. For more information, see Using Custom AMIs.
The default option is the current Amazon Linux version. For more information on the supported operating systems, see AWS OpsWorks Operating Systems.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.DefaultRootDeviceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultRootDeviceType.
The default root device type. This value is the default for all instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an instance. The default option is instance-store. For more information, see Storage for the Root Device.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.DefaultSshKeyName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultSshKeyName.
A default Amazon EC2 key pair name. The default value is none. If you specify a key pair name, AWS OpsWorks installs the public key on the instance and you can use the private key with an SSH client to log in to the instance. For more information, see
Using SSH to Communicate with an Instance and Managing SSH Access. You can override this setting by specifying a different key pair, or no key pair, when you create an instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.DefaultSubnetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultSubnetId.
The stack's default VPC subnet ID. This parameter is required if you specify a value for the VpcId parameter. All instances are launched into this subnet unless you specify otherwise when you create the instance. If you also specify a value for DefaultAvailabilityZone, the subnet must be in that zone. For information on default values and when this parameter is required, see the VpcId parameter description.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.HostnameTheme
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostnameTheme.
The stack's host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores. The theme is used to generate host names for the stack's instances. By default, HostnameTheme is set to Layer_Dependent, which creates host names by appending integers to the layer's short name. The other themes are:
Baked_Goods
Clouds
Europe_Cities
Fruits
Greek_Deities
Legendary_creatures_from_Japan
Planets_and_Moons
Roman_Deities
Scottish_Islands
US_Cities
Wild_Cats
To obtain a generated host name, call GetHostNameSuggestion, which returns a host name based on the current theme.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The stack name.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.Region
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Region.
The stack's AWS region, such as "us-east-1". For more information about Amazon regions, see Regions and Endpoints.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.ServiceRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceRoleArn.
The stack's AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role, which allows AWS OpsWorks to work with AWS resources on your behalf. You must set this parameter to the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an existing IAM role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.UseCustomCookbooks
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseCustomCookbooks.
Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.UseOpsworksSecurityGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UseOpsworksSecurityGroups.
Whether to associate the AWS OpsWorks built-in security groups with the stack's layers.
AWS OpsWorks provides a standard set of built-in security groups, one for each layer, which are associated with layers by default. With UseOpsworksSecurityGroups you can instead provide your own custom security groups. UseOpsworksSecurityGroups has the following settings:
True - AWS OpsWorks automatically associates the appropriate built-in security group with each layer (default setting). You can associate additional security groups with a layer after you create it, but you cannot delete the built-in security group.
False - AWS OpsWorks does not associate built-in security groups with layers. You must create appropriate EC2 security groups and associate a security group with each layer that you create. However, you can still manually associate a built-in security group with a layer on creation; custom security groups are required only for those layers that need custom settings.
For more information, see Create a New Stack.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateStackRequest.VpcId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcId.
The ID of the VPC that the stack is to be launched into. The VPC must be in the stack's region. All instances are launched into this VPC. You cannot change the ID later.
If your account supports EC2-Classic, the default value is no VPC.
If your account does not support EC2-Classic, the default value is the default VPC for the specified region.
If the VPC ID corresponds to a default VPC and you have specified either the DefaultAvailabilityZone or the DefaultSubnetId parameter only, AWS OpsWorks infers the value of the other parameter. If you specify neither parameter, AWS OpsWorks sets these parameters to the first valid Availability Zone for the specified region and the corresponding default VPC subnet ID, respectively.
If you specify a nondefault VPC ID, note the following:
It must belong to a VPC in your account that is in the specified region.
You must specify a value for DefaultSubnetId.
For more information on how to use AWS OpsWorks with a VPC, see Running a Stack in a VPC. For more information on default VPC and EC2-Classic, see Supported Platforms.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.CreateUserProfileRequest.SshUsername
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SshUsername.
The user's SSH user name. The allowable characters are [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], '-', and '_'. If the specified name includes other punctuation marks, AWS OpsWorks removes them. For example, my.name will be changed to myname. If you do not specify an SSH user name, AWS OpsWorks generates one from the IAM user name.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DeploymentCommand
member.summary: Used to specify a stack or deployment command.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DeploymentCommand.Args
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Args.
The arguments of those commands that take arguments. It should be set to a JSON object with the following format:
{"arg_name1" : ["value1", "value2", ...], "arg_name2" : ["value1", "value2", ...], ...}
The update_dependencies command takes two arguments:
upgrade_os_to - Specifies the desired Amazon Linux version for instances whose OS you want to upgrade, such as Amazon Linux 2014.09. You must also set the allow_reboot argument to true.
allow_reboot - Specifies whether to allow AWS OpsWorks to reboot the instances if necessary, after installing the updates. This argument can be set to either true or false. The default value is false.
For example, to upgrade an instance to Amazon Linux 2014.09, set Args to the following.
{ "upgrade_os_to":["Amazon Linux 2014.09"], "allow_reboot":["true"] }

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DeploymentCommand.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Specifies the operation. You can specify only one command.
For stacks, the following commands are available:
execute_recipes: Execute one or more recipes. To specify the recipes, set an Args parameter named recipes to the list of recipes to be executed. For example, to execute phpapp::appsetup, set Args to {"recipes":["phpapp::appsetup"]}.
install_dependencies: Install the stack's dependencies.
update_custom_cookbooks: Update the stack's custom cookbooks.
update_dependencies: Update the stack's dependencies. The update_dependencies and install_dependencies commands are supported only for Linux instances. You can run the commands successfully on Windows instances, but they do nothing.
For apps, the following commands are available:
deploy: Deploy an app. Ruby on Rails apps have an optional Args parameter named migrate. Set Args to {"migrate":["true"]} to migrate the database. The default setting is {"migrate":["false"]}.
rollback Roll the app back to the previous version. When you update an app, AWS OpsWorks stores the previous version, up to a maximum of five versions. You can use this command to roll an app back as many as four versions.
start: Start the app's web or application server.
stop: Stop the app's web or application server.
restart: Restart the app's web or application server.
undeploy: Undeploy the app.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DescribeAppsRequest
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DescribeEcsClustersRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeEcsClusters operation. Describes Amazon ECS clusters that are registered with a stack. If you specify only a stack ID, you can use the MaxResults and NextToken parameters to paginate the response. However, AWS OpsWorks currently supports only one cluster per layer, so the result set has a maximum of one element.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack or an attached policy that explicitly grants permission. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DescribeEcsClustersRequest.EcsClusterArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EcsClusterArns.
A list of ARNs, one for each cluster to be described.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DescribeEcsClustersRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
To receive a paginated response, use this parameter to specify the maximum number of results to be returned with a single call. If the number of available results exceeds this maximum, the response includes a NextToken value that you can assign to the NextToken request parameter to get the next set of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DescribeEcsClustersRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If the previous paginated request did not return all of the remaining results, the response object'sNextToken parameter value is set to a token. To retrieve the next set of results, call DescribeEcsClusters again and assign that token to the request object's NextToken parameter. If there are no remaining results, the previous response object's NextToken parameter is set to null.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DescribeEcsClustersRequest.StackId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StackId.
A stack ID. DescribeEcsClusters returns a description of the cluster that is registered with the stack.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DescribeEcsClustersResponse
member.summary: Contains the response to a DescribeEcsClusters request.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DescribeEcsClustersResponse.EcsClusters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EcsClusters.
A list of EcsCluster objects containing the cluster descriptions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DescribeEcsClustersResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If a paginated request does not return all of the remaining results, this parameter is set to a token that you can assign to the request object's NextToken parameter to retrieve the next set of results. If the previous paginated request returned all of the remaining results, this parameter is set to null.

member.summary:

member.summary:

member.summary: Contains the response to a DescribePermissions request.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.DescribePermissionsResponse.Permissions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Permissions.
An array of Permission objects that describe the stack permissions.
If the request object contains only a stack ID, the array contains a Permission object with permissions for each of the stack IAM ARNs.
If the request object contains only an IAM ARN, the array contains a Permission object with permissions for each of the user's stack IDs.
If the request contains a stack ID and an IAM ARN, the array contains a single Permission object with permissions for the specified stack and IAM ARN.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.EnvironmentVariable
member.summary: Represents an app's environment variable.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.EnvironmentVariable.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
(Required) The environment variable's name, which can consist of up to 64 characters and must be specified. The name can contain upper- and lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores (_), but it must start with a letter or underscore.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.EnvironmentVariable.Secure
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Secure.
(Optional) Whether the variable's value will be returned by the DescribeApps action. To conceal an environment variable's value, set Secure to true. DescribeApps then returns *****FILTERED***** instead of the actual value. The default value for Secure is false.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.EnvironmentVariable.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
(Optional) The environment variable's value, which can be left empty. If you specify a value, it can contain up to 256 characters, which must all be printable.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.GetHostnameSuggestionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetHostnameSuggestion operation. Gets a generated host name for the specified layer, based on the current host name theme.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.GetHostnameSuggestionRequest.LayerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LayerId.
The layer ID.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Hostname.
The generated host name.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LayerId.
The layer ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.GrantAccessRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GrantAccess operation. This action can be used only with Windows stacks.
Grants RDP access to a Windows instance for a specified time period.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.GrantAccessRequest.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The instance's AWS OpsWorks ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.GrantAccessRequest.ValidForInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ValidForInMinutes.
The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the grant expires at the end of this period, the user will no longer be able to use the credentials to log in. If the user is logged in at the time, he or she automatically will be logged out.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.GrantAccessResponse
member.summary: Contains the response to a GrantAccess request.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.GrantAccessResponse.TemporaryCredential
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TemporaryCredential.
A TemporaryCredential object that contains the data needed to log in to the instance by RDP clients, such as the Microsoft Remote Desktop Connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Instance.InstallUpdatesOnBoot
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstallUpdatesOnBoot.
Whether to install operating system and package updates when the instance boots. The default value is true. If this value is set to false, you must then update your instances manually by using CreateDeployment to run the update_dependencies stack command or by manually running yum (Amazon Linux) or apt-get (Ubuntu) on the instances.
We strongly recommend using the default value of true, to ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Recipes
member.summary:
AWS OpsWorks supports five lifecycle events: setup, configuration, deploy, undeploy, and shutdown. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks runs a set of standard recipes for each event. In addition, you can provide custom recipes for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks runs custom event recipes after the standard recipes. LayerCustomRecipes specifies the custom recipes for a particular layer to be run in response to each of the five events.
To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the recipe's file name without the .rb extension. For example: phpapp2::dbsetup specifies the dbsetup.rb recipe in the repository's phpapp2 folder.

An array of custom recipe names to be run following a configure event.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.RegisterInstanceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the RegisterInstance operation. Registers instances with a specified stack that were created outside of AWS OpsWorks.
We do not recommend using this action to register instances. The complete registration operation has two primary steps, installing the AWS OpsWorks agent on the instance and registering the instance with the stack. RegisterInstance handles only the second step. You should instead use the AWS CLI register command, which performs the entire registration operation. For more information, see Registering an Instance with an AWS OpsWorks Stack.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.SetLoadBasedAutoScalingRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the SetLoadBasedAutoScaling operation. Specify the load-based auto scaling configuration for a specified layer. For more information, see Managing Load with Time-based and Load-based Instances.
To use load-based auto scaling, you must create a set of load-based auto scaling instances. Load-based auto scaling operates only on the instances from that set, so you must ensure that you have created enough instances to handle the maximum anticipated load.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.SetLoadBasedAutoScalingRequest.DownScaling
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DownScaling.
An AutoScalingThresholds object with the downscaling threshold configuration. If the load falls below these thresholds for a specified amount of time, AWS OpsWorks stops a specified number of instances.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.SetLoadBasedAutoScalingRequest.Enable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Enable.
Enables load-based auto scaling for the layer.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.SetLoadBasedAutoScalingRequest.LayerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LayerId.
The layer ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.SetLoadBasedAutoScalingRequest.UpScaling
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpScaling.
An AutoScalingThresholds object with the upscaling threshold configuration. If the load exceeds these thresholds for a specified amount of time, AWS OpsWorks starts a specified number of instances.

member.summary: This is the response object from the SetLoadBasedAutoScaling operation.

member.summary: Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from a repository. For more information, see Creating Apps or Custom Recipes and Cookbooks.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Source.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
When included in a request, the parameter depends on the repository type.
For Amazon S3 bundles, set Password to the appropriate IAM secret access key.
For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set Password to the password.
For more information on how to safely handle IAM credentials, see .
In responses, AWS OpsWorks returns *****FILTERED***** instead of the actual value.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Source.Revision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Revision.
The application's version. AWS OpsWorks enables you to easily deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent different versions that can potentially be deployed.

The repository type.

The source URL.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.Source.Username
member.summary:

This parameter depends on the repository type.
For Amazon S3 bundles, set Username to the appropriate IAM access key ID.
For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories, set Username to the user name.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.StopInstanceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StopInstance operation. Stops a specified instance. When you stop a standard instance, the data disappears and must be reinstalled when you restart the instance. You can stop an Amazon EBS-backed instance without losing data. For more information, see Starting, Stopping, and Rebooting Instances.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.StopInstanceRequest.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The instance ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.StopInstanceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StopInstance operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.StopStackRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StopStack operation. Stops a specified stack.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.StopStackRequest.StackId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StackId.
The stack ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.StopStackResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StopStack operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.TemporaryCredential
member.summary: Contains the data needed by RDP clients such as the Microsoft Remote Desktop Connection to log in to the instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.TemporaryCredential.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The instance's AWS OpsWorks ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.TemporaryCredential.Password
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.TemporaryCredential.Username

The user name.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.TemporaryCredential.ValidForInMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ValidForInMinutes.
The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the grant expires, at the end of this period, the user will no longer be able to use the credentials to log in. If they are logged in at the time, they will be automatically logged out.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UnassignInstanceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UnassignInstance operation. Unassigns a registered instance from all of it's layers. The instance remains in the stack as an unassigned instance and can be assigned to another layer, as needed. You cannot use this action with instances that were created with AWS OpsWorks.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UnassignInstanceRequest.InstanceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceId.
The instance ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UnassignInstanceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UnassignInstance operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UnassignVolumeRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UnassignVolume operation. Unassigns an assigned Amazon EBS volume. The volume remains registered with the stack. For more information, see Resource Management.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UnassignVolumeRequest.VolumeId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeId.
The volume ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UnassignVolumeResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UnassignVolume operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest

Container for the parameters to the UpdateApp operation. Updates a specified app.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Deploy or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.AppId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AppId.
The app ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.AppSource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AppSource.
A Source object that specifies the app repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack attributes.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.DataSources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataSources.
The app's data sources.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the app.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.Domains
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Domains.
The app's virtual host settings, with multiple domains separated by commas. For example: 'www.example.com, example.com'

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.EnableSsl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableSsl.
Whether SSL is enabled for the app.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.Environment
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Environment.
An array of EnvironmentVariable objects that specify environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server instances.For more information, see Environment Variables.
There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables. However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes the variables' names, values, and protected flag values - cannot exceed 10 KB (10240 Bytes). This limit should accommodate most if not all use cases. Exceeding it will cause an exception with the message, "Environment: is too large (maximum is 10KB)."
This parameter is supported only by Chef 11.10 stacks. If you have specified one or more environment variables, you cannot modify the stack's Chef version.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The app name.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.SslConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SslConfiguration.
An SslConfiguration object with the SSL configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppRequest.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The app type.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateAppResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateApp operation.

Container for the parameters to the UpdateElasticIp operation. Updates a registered Elastic IP address's name. For more information, see Resource Management.
Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateElasticIpRequest.ElasticIp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ElasticIp.
The address.

member.name: T:Amazon.OpsWorks.Model.UpdateElasticIpResponse
